awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Mid-Atlantic Mathematical Logic      Seminar
awd_abstract_narration: The Mid-Atlantic Mathematical Logic Seminar (MAMLS) was                    formed in the fall of 1982.  It has held three meetings during                  each of 1982-83 and 1983-84.  In each of 1984-85, 1985-86, 1986-                87, 1987-88, and 1988-89 at least four meetings were held.                           The seminar covers a broad spectrum of mathematical logic                  with particular emphasis on complexity theory and theoretical                   computer science, models of arithmetic, model theory and model                  theoretic algebra, set theory, sub-systems of analysis (the                     "reverse mathematics" program of H. Friedman and S. Simpson) and                topos theory.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
